main.name: Mae Hoad
main.occupation: A student at Carngeige Mellon University
main.description: Major in Electrical and Computer Engineering

bio.intro: I'm Mae. A student at Carnegie Mellon University studying Electrical and Comptuer Engineering with a software focus. I'm also an archer, tennis player, runner, painter, and peanut butter lover.
bio.projects: My recent projects (this website including!) have been completed with React. My skills using this framework were developed in a software engineering intership at Call Levels in Singapore. I also developed an application called NextUP using react alongside a team in which we won third place in a CMU Computer Science Hackathon.
bio.women: I'm currently on the board of Women in Electrical and Computer Engineering (WinECE) at my university and have been involved with Women for Women Internation as the president of a satellite of (WfW) at my highschool.
bio.art: I love developing and creating not just with code, but also with paint and a paintbrush
bio.travel: I also love tyring new things and experiencing different cultures. I've traveled to over 15 countries and plant o
bio.adventurer: Alive skydiver and aspiring bungy jumper also prone to fear of falling. BUGGY!
bio.hiker: all hikes, especially, climb mt. rainer... dream to hike mt. fuji

main.contactmessage: Please use the contact information below to get into contact with me

work.title: Software Engineering Intern
work.description: Developed web-based Call Levels aaplication using React on a firebase platform.
work.info: Working abroad was a tremendous experience being immersed in a different culture. Here, I learned React and was able to create this website.

work.title: Teaching Assistant
work.description: Taught fundamentals of programming and computer science in python.
work.info: I was fortunate to teach our largest intro course at CMU, and ranked as one of the top 5 CS course in the US. Teaching was one of my favorite experience and from taking the course to teaching was a rewarding journey.

work.title: Electrical Engineering Intern
work.description: Worked with Dr. Dov Kruger designing an automated boat and experimented in 3D printing and CAD
work.info: This experience came after an Engineering and Science program at Stevens Institute of Technology.

work.title: Tennis Coach
work.description: Coached for 30 kids, ages 5-8, teaching the fundamentals of tennis
work.info: Although a different medium of material from computer science, and audience of students, this experience was still just as valuble. Engaging with children for seven hours a day taught me skills of patience, kindness, and enjoyment.

projects.name: Shot Tracker
projects.description: Developed web-based Call Levels aaplication using React on a firebase platform.
projects.info: Working abroad was a tremendous experience being immersed in a different culture. Here, I learned React and was able to create this website.

projects.name: NextUp
projects.description: Application that allows for group queuing utilizing Spotipy API library in python with a Reaact front end running in tandem with a Flask
projects.info: I created this app with a team during a Carnegie Mellon Computer Science Hackaton in which we on 3rd place. The inspirationw as to eliminate disparities between user songs

art.artBio: Before my passion for computers and developing I enjoyed a different form of creation: art. When I wasn't in our high school computer lab, I could be found in my garage, using my archery target as a easle for my paintings. Most of my art is inspired from places that I've traveled to.

images.name: Lady and the Plant
images.medium: oil pastel and pencil on paper

images.name: My Secret Garden
